properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 4:39PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
Much warmer temperatures are headed to the Interior starting
Monday and continuing through the week. Highs will be pushing
into the teens above to around 30 above, and lows will be in
the single digits above and below zero.

A strong low pressure system will move into the Eastern Bering
Sea Monday and a weather front will move north to the Brooks
Range. The low will move up the West Coast and dissipate Tuesday,
but another low will move in behind it mid week. Warm air will
surge north into the Interior as strong Chinook winds develop
across the Alaska Range Monday and Tuesday.

Precipitation will generally be west of the Interior with a slight
chance of snow near the Brooks Range.

As the temperatures rise there is a high potential for frost to
develop on the cold soaked roads of the Interior making traveling
conditions difficult in the warmer locations.

For the latest Interior forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
